block.p: Thea Medernach Mohr, the daughter of Joan Mohr and Dr. J. P. Mohr of New York, was married yesterday to Daniel Anthony Saks, a son of the actress Bea Arthur of Los Angeles and the director Gene Saks of New York. The Rev. Gregory J. Rupright, a United Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the Union Chapel in the Grove on Shelter Island.

The bride, 35, is a freelance textbook illustrator. Until last week, she was an editor at John Wiley & Sons, the publisher in New York. She graduated from Bard College. Her father is the Sciarra Professor of Clinical Neurology at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons in New York. Her mother is a docent at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

The bride, 35, is a freelance textbook illustrator. Until last week, she was an editor at John Wiley & Sons, the publisher in New York. She graduated from Bard College. Her father is the Sciarra Professor of Clinical Neurology at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons in New York. Her mother is a docent at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
The bridegroom, 36, is a set designer for television and stage in Los Angeles. He graduated from Sarah Lawrence College.

His mother starred in the television sitcoms ''Golden Girls'' and ''Maude'' and on Broadway in ''Mame.'' His father has won three Tony Awards as a stage director, for ''I Love My Wife,'' ''Brighton Beach Memoirs'' and ''Biloxi Blues.'' His movies include adaptations of the Broadway plays ''The Odd Couple'' and ''Barefoot in the Park.''
